content:
What I understand we have introduced a "new" date and time format and I think @Sebastien Rosset knows a lot about this.
The "wxLOCALE_TIME_FMT" used in datetime.cpp produce a very long text about time zone and normal/summer time. (See attached shot)
This text is normally undesirable and steals space in small dialogues. ( Also discussed here )
I think we need to find a way to format e.g. "$hour_minutes_seconds" and "$24_hour_minutes_seconds" to not include the extra info (provided by the OS in local language ).
Any thoughts and advises about this?
bild.png

I see that Debian is more restricted and answer "CEST" for the the same localization. Could we in some way override Windows extensive message and replace it with e.g. "CEST" or "LMT" ? I don't t know about how Mac handle this.
This topic was moved here from #OCPN 5.12 Release Plan > Date and Time format by Alec Leamas.
